privacyLaws.lawName: Iowa Consumer Data Protection Act (Iowa CDPA)
privacyLaws.description: On March 29, Iowa became the sixth state to enact a comprehensive privacy law. The law, which will take effect on January 1, 2025, would give organizations 21 months to meet the new standards set by this state.

personalDataCategories: Personal data of a known child

individualRights.name: Right to Know if a controller is processing the consumer’s personal information
Right to Opt Out sale of personal data

notice.description: A controller shall not process sensitive data collected from a consumer for a nonexempt purpose without the consumer having been presented with clear notice

purposeLimitation.description: Personal data processed by a controller Adequate, relevant, and limited to what is necessary in relation to the specific purposes listed in this section

securityReqs.description: A controller shall adopt and implement reasonable administrative, technical, and physical data security practices to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and accessibility of personal data. Such data security practices shall be appropriate to the volume and nature of the personal data at issue

processorReqs.description: Processors are required to assist controllers in fulfilling their obligations under the chapter by employing appropriate technical and organizational measures. Contracts between controllers and processors must govern data processing procedures and include instructions for processing personal data, the nature and purpose of processing, data subject types, duration of processing, and the rights and duties of both parties.

breachNotification.description: Controllers are obligated in relation to the security of processing the personal data and in relation to the notification of a breach of the security of the system

dataTransfer.description: The sale of persoanl data does not include the disclosure or transfer of personal data to an affiliate of the controller

exemptions.description: State, judicial department, or local government entities
Financial institution or an affiliate of a financial institution governed by, or personal data collected, processed, sold, or disclosed in accordance with the GLBA
Covered entity or business associate as defined in the privacy regulations of HIPAA
Institutions of higher education are exempted

preemption: This chapter supersedes and preempts all rules, regulations, codes, ordinances, and other laws adopted by a city, county, municipality, or local agency regarding the processing of personal data by controllers or processors

penalties: The attorney general may initiate an action in the name of the state and may seek an injunction to restrain any violations of this chapter and civil penalties of up to 7,500 dollars for each violation under this chapter
personalLiability: Nothing in this section shall be construed to relieve a controller or a processor from imposed liabilities by virtue of the controller or processor’s role in the processing relationship as defined by this chapter
privateRightOfAction: Nothing in this legislation shall be construed as providing the basis for, or being subject to, a private right of action for violations of this legislation or any other law.

threshold.description: Control or process personal data of 100,000 or more consumers.
The personal data of 25,000 or more consumers, while deriving 50% or more of the annual gross revenue from selling personal data

otherPrivacyLaws.description: Chapter 715C of the Iowa Code, titled Personal Information Security Breach Protection, defines various terms related to personal information security breaches and outlines notification requirements and remedies in case of a breach.
